titleStmt.title: The late Earl of Lindsey his title by which himself, and his participants, do claim 24000. acres of land in the fennes in Lincoln-shire; and concerning which a bill hath pass'd the House of Lords, and is now with the Commons, impowring Sir Henry Heron and Sir William Killigrew to perfect their undertakings; the which, if it hath not been according to the particulars contained in this paper, the countenance of any member of this House is in no sort desired hereunto.
titleStmt.author: Killigrew, William, Sir, 1606-1695.
Heron, Henry, Sir. aut

titleStmt.title: The late Earl of Lindsey his title by which himself, and his participants, do claim 24000. acres of land in the fennes in Lincoln-shire; and concerning which a bill hath pass'd the House of Lords, and is now with the Commons, impowring Sir Henry Heron and Sir William Killigrew to perfect their undertakings; the which, if it hath not been according to the particulars contained in this paper, the countenance of any member of this House is in no sort desired hereunto.
titleStmt.author: Killigrew, William, Sir, 1606-1695.
Heron, Henry, Sir. aut

notesStmt.note: Signed and dated at end: July 1: 1661; Henry Heron, William Killigrew.
Reproduction of the original in the Goldsmiths' Library.
